greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array read by antidiagonals in which rows are indexed by composite numbers w and row w gives n such that n^(w-1) == 1 (mod w^2).
comment: We can say that "w is a Wieferich pseudoprime to base n".
Any prime factor of w is a Wieferich prime to base n.
link: Robert Price, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..1276
program: (PARI) forcomposite(w=2, 20, print1("w=", w, ": "); for(n=2, 10^3, if(Mod(n, w^2)^(w-1)==1, print1(n, ", "))); print(""))
results.author: _Felix Fröhlich_, Jul 05 2014
